Description: This auction is for a used Godin LGX-SA AAA Flamed Maple Cognac Burst Electric Guitar. The guitar has 3 voices: electric, acoustic, and synth access. The guitar has a mahogany body with a AAA-grade figured maple top. The mahogany neck has an ebony fingerboard that significantly improves synth tracking as compared to a rosewood fretboard. The custom RMC system provides acoustic guitar sounds from a bridge transducer, while Seymour Duncan custom humbuckers drive the electric tone. Synth access comes courtesy of the 13-pin connector for direct control of Roland GR Series and Axon AX100 guitar synths. Acoustic and electric outputs can be used alone or in tandem to further expand the tonal array. The guitar features: 1) Mahogany body with a AA-grade flamed maple top 2) Mahogany neck with ebony fingerboard for improved synth tracking 3) Custom RMC system deliver acoustic tone from a bridge transducer 4) Custom Seymour Duncan humbuckers 5) 13-pin connector provides synth/computer access for limitless tonal possibilities 6) Acoustic/Mix and Electric outputs can be used alone or blended 7) Includes a gig bag The guitar is in excellent condition and full functional with no significant defects—I tested the synth on a Roland VG-99. I have installed a fresh battery and new stings (Ernie Ball Regular Slinky). Shipping is via Fed Ex ground. I will only ship domestically, and international shipping is handled by Ebay global shipping. I will not accept bids from anyone with no feedback, questionable feedback, frequent name changes, a history of poor transactions, or anything that I am uncomfortable with. For those using Paypal, I will only ship to a confirmed address and no drop shipping.
Title: Godin LGX-SA AAA Flamed Maple Cognac Burst Electric Guitar With Gig Bag
Subtitle: Guitar Features 3 Voices: Electric, Acoustic & Synth
ConditionDescription: The guitar is fully functional with no significant defects- the body and top are clean. I have installed a fresh battery and installed new strings. The synth function was tested on my Roland VG-99. The gig bag has never been used and shows as new.
